definition: grass radical 草字頭兒|草字头儿[cao3 zi4 tou2 r5]
lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic
callus (patch or hardened skin)/corns (on feet)/also 老趼
to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist by his own petard
callus (patch or hardened skin)/corns (on feet)/also 趼子
lit. to spin silk from cocoons/fig. to make a painstaking investigation (idiom)
lit. to break through a cocoon and turn into a butterfly (idiom)/fig. to emerge strong after a period of struggle/to get to a better place after going through difficult period
to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist with his own petard

sentences.english: Corn pollen can be the supplemental food for M. cingulum.
sentences.chinese: 玉米花粉可以作为腰带长体茧蜂的补充营养。

sentences.english: Firstly we should boil the well-chosen single-chamber cocoon with high temperature.
sentences.chinese: 首先我们应该在高温蒸煮中精心挑最佳品质的茧。

sentences.english: They bite their way out of the caterpillar and begin spinning cocoons.
sentences.chinese: 然后它们会寻路冲破毛毛虫体外开始做茧。

sentences.english: The cocoon-to-butterfly theory only works on cocoons and butterflies.
sentences.chinese: 因为茧变蝴蝶理论，只可能发生在茧和蝴蝶身上。

sentences.english: It was free to shed it's cocoon of anger and fear and sadness.
sentences.chinese: 小字眼自由地蜕去了愤怒，恐惧和悲伤的茧。

sentences.english: Nests and cocoons provide security for wildlife.
sentences.chinese: 巢和茧为野生动物提供了安全保障。

sentences.english: Form a callus or callus es.
sentences.chinese: 形成茧或皮肤的硬结组织。

sentences.english: Mass Cocoon. As ectoplasmic cocoon, but bigger.
sentences.chinese: 与星质茧相同，不过更大。

sentences.english: The water took so long to recede, the trees became covered in a cocoon of spiderwebs.
sentences.chinese: 洪水过了很久才退去，树木成了被蜘蛛网包裹的茧。

sentences.english: Mother's feet have a layer of the cocoon I be careful of petting.
sentences.chinese: 母亲的脚上有一层茧，我小心的抚摸。

sentences.english: Method of using radish seedling as plant host to propagate peach aphid for mass rearing Aphidius gifuensis was studied in the laboratory.
sentences.chinese: 研究了用萝卜苗作桃蚜寄主植物繁殖烟蚜茧蜂的技术。

sentences.english: IKEPT for nearly a year the flask-shaped cocoon of an emperor moth.
sentences.chinese: 我有一个天蛾的茧儿，差不多藏了一年。

sentences.english: I kept for nearly a year the flask-shaped cocoon of an emperor moth.
sentences.chinese: 我有一个天蛾的茧儿，差不多藏了一年。

sentences.english: The automatic control system mainly applies to boiling cocoon assembly line in the reeling silk factory.
sentences.chinese: 该煮茧机自动控制系统主要应用于缫丝厂煮茧流水线。

sentences.english: If I split out its cocoon, it will be free.
sentences.chinese: 如果我用刀帮它划开茧，它就自由了。

sentences.english: Found firmly die and rotten silkworm cocoon, cocoon good to avoid contamination.
sentences.chinese: 坚决拾去死蚕和烂茧，以免污染好茧。

definition: callus (patch or hardened skin)/corns (on feet)/also 趼子
skin cast off during molting/exuvia/to pupate/to molt/to slough/to cast off an old skin or shell
(of spiders, caterpillars, silkworms etc) to extrude silk
cage used to hold or transport prisoners
